title: >>> A "PIERCING" Party!
body_text:
"The glory of the masses of friends coming together in celebration of friendship and good sportsmanship shall live in our memory always ... The stories shall continue into our future generations to come."
- ALISON BERTSCH
That's what it's all about. Those who strive on the weekly competition could relax even for a few minutes and just enjoy the company of one another. And for one icon, it'll be a celebration never forgotten. Welcome to Justin Pierce's brithday bash!
The decorations were up, the cake was out, dodgeball's finest stars has arrived ...
Because of this special occasion, Justin ruled DODGEBALL 78 as he saw fit. Stipulations, gametypes, and even the captains were handpicked by the legend.
>> Juan Londono vs. Chris Adams
Here's a smash-mouth, and rather unlikely encounter. The experienced Chris Adams going one-on-one with recent star Juan Londono in only the second
Pick Your Poison
match. Under
Prison Ball
rules, all hell was sure to break loose at dodgeball's 78th spectacular.
There was no "ifs", "ands", or "buts" about this one. Chris chose one unstoppable team for that of his foe, a team that would eventually lead to his downfall at DODGEBALL 78. Team JUAN was fearless in their attempt to conquer Team CHRIS, and game after game, the wins racked up for the first-time captain. With powerful arms and witty plays like the controversial "Prison Pyramids", Chris indeed picked his own poison, the poison that killed any chances of him winning.
- Perhaps the biggest assets on Team JUAN were that of the women. The talented Melissa Kerr scored elimination after elimination, as did the powerful Alison Bertsch. Diana DiBuccio sent her share of enemies to the sidelines and was relentless in her defensive efforts.
- Though always outnumbered, Sascha Basista and Ryan McCrorey were consistently the last remaining players for Team CHRIS, so props are certainly in order.
Juan Londono soundly defeated Chris Adams, 3 - 0, in only the second [captains] shut-out win in dodgeball's year and half history.
The night was called off unsually early do to the sudden knee injury of one Lauren Stopa. We hope to have an update on the fallen
Female Titan
in the coming days.
Moments:
the Dodgeball Pinata, "Prison Pyramids" thanks to the "backing" of Rob Avakian and Lenny Herrera, Tim Burns's running nutshot compliments of Tom Adams, and the overall celebration for one Justin Pierce.
RECORDS SECTION
> Attendance: 22
> Biggest Return: Darien Brown (Last played at DODGEBALL 33)
> New Players: (1) Tim Burns
- DODGEBALL 78 hosted Justin Pierce's 23rd surprise birthday party, organized by Lauren Stopa and Diana DiBuccio.
- Justin picked captains, stipulations, and gametype of his choosing.
- DODGEBALL 78 hosted only the second
Pick Your Poison
match. Chris Adams has been featured in both, the first at DODGEBALL 75.
- DODGEBALL 78 was contested under
Prison Ball
Rules, ending around 10:20pm.
- Juan Londono scored only the second [captains] shut-out victory in history [following Kathryn Nogueira's defeat of Aimee Savoth at DODGEBALL LXV]. This was Juan's debut as captain.
- Chris now holds the #1 spot for "Most Times Captain" with 8. He stands at 4-4-0.
- Cake, pasta, chips, and even pizza from Luke were just some of the goodies at DODGEBALL 78.
- On a final note, DODGEBALL 78 fell on dodgeball's 1 and 1/2 years anniversary.
THANKS!
Diana DiBuccio and especially Lauren Stopa should be thanked for all their hard work and effort. DODGEBALL 78 had been planned for weeks by the female duo and delivered in a big way. Everyone who brought/made food are also thanked for their contributions.
Thanks to Ryan McCrorey who donated all of the Toms River Tournament DVD proceeds to the
TOM FUND
. The total as of March 4 is around
$51
!
DODGEBALL 79: Birthday Bash Part 2!
This one won't be a surprise as the dodgeball community will celebrate 25 years of Chris Adams! Remember,
3pm
start time is in effect! Check back during the week for the official preview! Until then feast your eyes on the comedic poster below:
________________________________________
_
Season 8 Finale!
body_html:
"The glory of the masses of friends coming together in celebration of friendship and good sportsmanship shall live in our memory always ... The stories shall continue into our future generations to come."
- ALISON BERTSCH

That's what it's all about. Those who strive on the weekly competition could relax even for a few minutes and just enjoy the company of one another. And for one icon, it'll be a celebration never forgotten. Welcome to Justin Pierce's brithday bash!

The decorations were up, the cake was out, dodgeball's finest stars has arrived ...

Because of this special occasion, Justin ruled DODGEBALL 78 as he saw fit. Stipulations, gametypes, and even the captains were handpicked by the legend.

>> Juan Londono vs. Chris Adams
Here's a smash-mouth, and rather unlikely encounter. The experienced Chris Adams going one-on-one with recent star Juan Londono in only the second Pick Your Poison match. Under Prison Ball rules, all hell was sure to break loose at dodgeball's 78th spectacular.

There was no "ifs", "ands", or "buts" about this one. Chris chose one unstoppable team for that of his foe, a team that would eventually lead to his downfall at DODGEBALL 78. Team JUAN was fearless in their attempt to conquer Team CHRIS, and game after game, the wins racked up for the first-time captain. With powerful arms and witty plays like the controversial "Prison Pyramids", Chris indeed picked his own poison, the poison that killed any chances of him winning.

- Perhaps the biggest assets on Team JUAN were that of the women. The talented Melissa Kerr scored elimination after elimination, as did the powerful Alison Bertsch. Diana DiBuccio sent her share of enemies to the sidelines and was relentless in her defensive efforts.

- Though always outnumbered, Sascha Basista and Ryan McCrorey were consistently the last remaining players for Team CHRIS, so props are certainly in order.

Juan Londono soundly defeated Chris Adams, 3 - 0, in only the second [captains] shut-out win in dodgeball's year and half history.

The night was called off unsually early do to the sudden knee injury of one Lauren Stopa. We hope to have an update on the fallen Female Titan in the coming days.

Moments: the Dodgeball Pinata, "Prison Pyramids" thanks to the "backing" of Rob Avakian and Lenny Herrera, Tim Burns's running nutshot compliments of Tom Adams, and the overall celebration for one Justin Pierce.

RECORDS SECTION
> Attendance: 22
> Biggest Return: Darien Brown (Last played at DODGEBALL 33)
> New Players: (1) Tim Burns

- DODGEBALL 78 hosted Justin Pierce's 23rd surprise birthday party, organized by Lauren Stopa and Diana DiBuccio.
- Justin picked captains, stipulations, and gametype of his choosing.
- DODGEBALL 78 hosted only the second Pick Your Poison match. Chris Adams has been featured in both, the first at DODGEBALL 75.
- DODGEBALL 78 was contested under Prison Ball Rules, ending around 10:20pm.
- Juan Londono scored only the second [captains] shut-out victory in history [following Kathryn Nogueira's defeat of Aimee Savoth at DODGEBALL LXV]. This was Juan's debut as captain.
- Chris now holds the #1 spot for "Most Times Captain" with 8. He stands at 4-4-0.
- Cake, pasta, chips, and even pizza from Luke were just some of the goodies at DODGEBALL 78.
- On a final note, DODGEBALL 78 fell on dodgeball's 1 and 1/2 years anniversary.

THANKS!
Diana DiBuccio and especially Lauren Stopa should be thanked for all their hard work and effort. DODGEBALL 78 had been planned for weeks by the female duo and delivered in a big way. Everyone who brought/made food are also thanked for their contributions.

Thanks to Ryan McCrorey who donated all of the Toms River Tournament DVD proceeds to the TOM FUND. The total as of March 4 is around $51!

DODGEBALL 79: Birthday Bash Part 2!
This one won't be a surprise as the dodgeball community will celebrate 25 years of Chris Adams! Remember, 3pm start time is in effect! Check back during the week for the official preview! Until then feast your eyes on the comedic poster below:

Season 8 Finale!
